definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle

sentences.english: The pusher, not qualified products to sell fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 致使不法商販渾水摸魚，出售不合格產品。

sentences.english: He bought some home-made explosives from the street traders.
sentences.chinese: 商販那兒買了一些土製炸藥。

sentences.english: When the small dealer was small, he didn't like to wear smalls .
sentences.chinese: 小商販在小的時候，不喜歡穿內衣褲。

sentences.english: Vendors here sell handmade rugs, clothing and glittering embroidered slippers.
sentences.chinese: 商販們在售賣陶罐，服裝和亮光閃閃的繡花拖鞋。

sentences.english: Some were haggling loudly with traders as they hawked their wares.
sentences.chinese: 有些人正在大聲同兜售貨物的商販講價錢。

sentences.english: The peddlers went to every alley and street to make money to support their families.
sentences.chinese: 小商販們走街串巷賺點小錢養家餬口。

sentences.english: Some small traders at this tourist spot are notorious for their overcharging customers.
sentences.chinese: 這個旅遊景點的一些小商販以宰客而臭名遠揚。

sentences.english: Trade can be slow, and a gaggle of bored shopkeepers sit around a table sipping tea as a couple of college-aged students browse for gifts for their professors.
sentences.chinese: 貿易可能進行緩慢，一羣無聊的商販坐在一起品茶。

sentences.english: Peddleries usually overbid to gain more profits.
sentences.chinese: 商販經常報謊價以便獲得更高的利潤。

sentences.english: The trader pushing small dray is selling watermelon.
sentences.chinese: 那個推着板車的商販正在賣西瓜。

sentences.english: For a small business looking to increase referrals, social media can be a powerful tool.
sentences.chinese: 對小商販來說，大衆傳媒更是增加訂單的有力工具。

sentences.english: The man thanked the peddler and walked away towards the hill and eventually disappeared out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 那人謝了商販朝山坡走去，漸漸地消失了。

sentences.english: This is my first time to see fresh lotus seed. The peddler is hawking.
sentences.chinese: 這是我第一次看見新鮮的蓮子，小商販正圍車叫賣。

sentences.english: A third seller said authorities were still allowing sales of chickens.
sentences.chinese: 另有一個商販說，有關部門仍允許賣活雞。

sentences.english: He looked more than ever like a prosperous bagman.
sentences.chinese: 他比以往任何時候都更象一個生意興隆的商販了。

definition: to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
